other_tests.findings: The gallbladder is markedly distended with circumferential wall thickening and edema. A 10 mm stone is seen within the gallbladder neck, with smaller stones in the gallbladder fundus. Extensive pericholecystic fat stranding and fluid are present. Moderate intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation and dilation of the common duct to 10 mm are noted, with no intraductal stone or mass. A non-enhancing lesion in the pancreatic body/tail and a likely adenoma in the left adrenal gland are observed. Several renal cysts and a hemorrhagic cyst are identified. There is also a trace of perihepatic and perisplenic ascites and a trace right pleural effusion.
